title: "We don't want to touch Kassadin's ult. We feel like it defines the champ''
body:
Kassadin
Riftwalk (R) range reduced to 450 from 700
Riftwalk (R) mana cost reduced to 60 at all ranks from 75 
[Mana cost as he gains stacks now 60/120/240/480 from 75/150/300/600.]

Basically gutted him. Taking away his ult's movement by almost half? REALLY? God forbid they would ever get rid of Lee's ability to jump to a ward. No way would they take away the ability for Zed to port back to his shadow during ult. As if they would take away Annie's ability to stun with Tibbers. The balance team needs to be fired.

6 seconds at max rank and 40% CDR, so not by much.

By max rank with 40% CDR {{champion:7}} ult has ~14ish CD.

That's {{champion:64}} W CD for the sake of comparison.

By the way {{champion:7}} is supposed to "fall off" ha, ha, ha. 

IMHO any champion that does what it wants all game long (( {{champion:238}} {{champion:103}} ( yes, even before her rework ) {{champion:150}} {{champion:7}} {{champion:76}} {{champion:92}} )) is fundamentally broken.

I may narrow the species down by saying they have a way to farm safely, have mobility & live without real cost to their abilities.

I mean compared to zed or kat, She does "fall off"
In the span of a teamfight she can usually only kill 1 or 2 people
Whereas zed or kat late game will almost always kill at least 3

When you look at her numbers, she was never meant to fall off numerically. However, she's still an assassin. WHich used to be a really bad thing in teamfight (s2-s3 I think?). Right now, it doesn't seem to matter that much overall. But, in a fully fledge, b-the-book 5v5 teamfight, I'd rather have a brand, orianna or syndra than a leblanc.

So, we get to the main core of the problem where an assassin is bad because it only assassinates one person.
And people wonder why assassins get abused so much.

I feel Kassadin is alright where he is. I mean, yeah he has an annoying amount of mobility, and a decent amount of burst. But the thing is, that's who he is as a champion. He is meant to be a highly mobile assassin jumping out of nowhere to nuke the enemy AP carry and vanish over a wall. But currently, the balancing factors are A: His lack of range, B: He is so mana hungry he has to sacrifice getting early burst for mana items, and C: He gets utterly destroyed by silences and AD champions. But through my PBE experience and information on his upcoming nerfs, he's about to be gutted. Wasted 975 rp on the Harbinger skin in time to watch him get destroyed.

There is nobody in this world who can read his ulti's description, including scaling, effect, cd and resource, and not shake his/her head.

Agree with pretty much all of this.

Meh. If you ask me, they should've done this a really long time ago before trying to gut his damage or anything else. His ult has always been the biggest problem in his kit, so they should've tried addressing that before doing all that "let's throw changes at the wall and see what sticks" that they did to him before.

If you ask me, Riot is actually too cowardly when it comes to changing champion identities. Maybe it's understandable due to community backlash, but sometimes it's downright necessary. Rengar will never be a balanced champion while his ultimate functions in any kind of similar vein to the way it does now. Kassadin was never going to be balanceable while he was blinking huge distances all over the map - either he would have enough damage to be OP, or not enough and be useless. Katarina will never be a balanced champion for a huge variety of reasons. Veigar's kit in it's current state is not balanceable. Kalista is not balanceable. 

These champions identities should not be maintained (or at least should be significantly shifted), because their binary natures are inherently rooted in their identities.

Why do people say things like "this part of the kit makes him impossible to balance"??? It's not like diving headfirst into an enemy to kill them and having a horrible early game isn't counterable...

Its less that he dives into the enemy team, and more that having what basically equates to flash on such a short cooldown; gives him one of the strongest roams in the game (if not the strongest in terms of overall mobility)

Riftwalk is an incredibly strong ability, which is evident by just how much Kassadin has been nerfed, and even with those nerfs he's still seen competitive play.

When I say "balance properly" I mean Kassadin is always going to be RIDICULOUSLY weak in some fashion, as long as he has Riftwalk; since if he ever returned to any semblance of a strong laner again, he would likely become that infamous "always banned" champion again.

Edit: For Riftwalk to not be incredibly strong, it has to be absolutely gutted to the point of just not feeling like a good skill (kind of like it has been now, which is why I suggested replacing it; no point of having an ult, that doesn't feel like an ult)

Okay, NO assassin has a gamechanging cc ult. An assassin's job is to primarily kill one target, not to stun the entire team or become a tank. Kassadin not having this utility is not a weakness, it's something completely normal for all assassins. It's like the people who say a certain tank is weak because it doesn't have an escape. It's a tank. It's not supposed to have escapes. So saying that Kass is balanced because he lacks something that every other assassin lacks is bullshit.
Kass can dish out enormous damage without his ult, he has no trouble doing his job with 4 low cooldown spells.

Erm what?

You know what else assassins have? Mobility.
Do you know where Kassadin is least mobile? Pre-6 before he gets his ult.

Also, champs like Katarina, Yasuo, Fiora, Tryndamere all have game changing ults and they have the job of an assassin.

Kassadin has the longest ramp up to become a true assassin except for Poppy because he's highly item dependent.

Also Kass has like no damage on his ult, it's extremely low and can only really finish off champs that could've been killed by a simple AA.

And yes, he does have problems because if you build him as an Assassin you have to be upclose and personal with his W (His assassin ability) and having to wait 3 seconds before you can riftwalk out WILL lead to death because before late game Kassadin is extremely squishy.

His Q does shit damage now because they nerfed it (Why the fuck are they nerfing Kass again after they nerfed his already trash laning phase?) and his E is mostly used for utility slow and general AOE damage.

His ult and W is his bread and butter as an assassin.

So ahri and fizz can do kass job better than him.
